intro: Adenocalymma macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-fruited adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It produces large, woody capsules as its fruit, which contain several seeds. Adenocalymma macrocarpum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
